transcripts.text: A heart-stopping moment for people in Los Angeles when loud explosions rocked the night air and military helicopters descended to land on one of the city's busiest streets.  Jim Murray explains what was going on.
Oh, my God.  Los Angeles under attack?
It sure looked that way as Black Hawk helicopters flew in formation right over downtown buildings in the pitch dark.
You can even hear an explosion.
Choppers landed smack in the middle of Wilshire Boulevard.  Soldiers could be seen running to climb on board in this video shot by a guy out his apartment window.  The U.S.

Army did send out a media advisory about the drill, the purpose of which was to enhance soldier skills by operating in various urban environments and settings.  Okay, here's where the government lays it on thick, kids.  Residents may hear sounds associated with training, including aircraft and weapons simulations.  Citizens in close proximity to the areas the training will take place will be notified prior to the training.  Ask any of these people that were being interviewed on the streets and none of them were given a heads up as to what was going on.  Everybody was in shock.
